intro: Dysoxylum poilanei, commonly known as the African sand-pear, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval-shaped berries containing smooth, black seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
